Key:
E-Everyone, please! Be quiet.
Presenting... a new transfer student!
I am Maria Arusu. A pleasure to meet everyone.

(As homeroom kicked off, Maria was welcomed
into our class, introduced as a transfer student.
The class murmured amongst themselves.)

I have a question! Where'd you come from,
Arusu-san?

Where did I come from? I walked here
from Shido's house.
(Oh, shoot.)
Wh-What does she mean, Shido?!
Again...? Have you done it again?!

I know not what you are asking, but my
words were clear. I ate breakfast at Shido's
house, then walked with him to school.
Wh-Wh-Wh-What does that mean, Shido?!
Explain... Explain yourself!!

No need to repeat yourself! Um, firstly, Maria.
I think that he was trying to ask about where
you lived before you transferred here.

Understood. It was a case of answering the
question literally. However, it seems I was
successful in making an impression.
Huh?

From Itsuka-kun's house... What does that mean?
They even ate breakfast together...

They're already speaking like they're close.
That's suspicious. Could she be another rival
to Tohka?

Laying hands on a transfer student on their
first day... is definitely NOT cool.
Ugh. I-It's not what you think. This is, um...

Maria's from another country. She moved to Japan
for her parents' work, but they couldn't move
with her, so she's staying at my place for now...
(Gah. Everyone's clearly suspicious...)
R-Right, Maria?!
Hm...
(Please, nod in agreement to my story.)

It's as Shido says. Until my parents settle into
their new housing, I must reside with Shido.
Our parents are acquaintances.
(...Whew.)
Really?! Is that so?!

Er, you've heard about the situation before,
so you don't have to act so surprised.

U-Um... Then, Arusu-san, you can take a seat
in the back... Oh.

(Without waiting for Yoshino's instructions,
Maria started approaching me.)
Shido, was my answer adequate?

Yeah, you saved me. I almost had a heart
attack.

I was hesitant to make a false statement,
but it was for your sake, Shido.
For my sake?

If someone is in trouble, you help them.
Does this conflict with your principles,
Shido?
No, it doesn't. Thanks, Maria.
That is one favor owed.
A favor, really...?
U-Um... Your seats, please!
R-Right. Sorry...

Is it not advised to use honorifics when
addressing a teacher?

Er, it is, but I messed up. You should take a
seat too.

Yes. There is a limit to how often I can speak
like this.
So you knew... Anyway, take a seat.
Yes.

Oh, Arusu-san. You said you're staying at
Itsuka's house, but are you okay? He hasn't
been weird, has he? He's a real Lothario.
Tonomachi, stop bad-mouthing me behind my―

I am fine, Hiroto Tonomachi. If you are worried
for my sake, then please tell me more about this
school.
Er? Huh?
Me?
Do you mean me?
Yes.

I-I-I would love to! I, Hiroto Tonomachi,
will do anything for you, Arusu-san!
I see. Thank you very much.

Whoohoooo, finally, spring has come for me!
Heh heh, heh heh heh heh...

(Tonomachi, even in this world, you're so
pathetic...)

(But still, Maria is actually trying to
 interact with everyone.)

(There's something different about her than
when we first met. I thought she was stoic, but
she's actually cute. Kinda mysterious, too.)
My memories are a little fuzzy for some reason.

(I wonder why that is. Something doesn't add up.
I'm missing something... I think.)
Well, it's probably my imagination.
